reviews.text:
Best Southern Thai food in the U.S.!
Iâ€™m originally from the South of Thailand, and this place is truly authentic â€” the flavors, the spices, everything feels just like home. Iâ€™ll definitely come back again. Highly recommended!
Perfect for elevated fam style dining and fun drinks. Authentic chefs and lovely service.
I enjoyed coming here to celebrate my bf birthday. Our favorites were the squid ink rice, chicken wings and brisket green curry.
Best Thai outside of Thailandâ€¦ the soft shell crab curry was life changing. The Massamam Duck confit was also so delicious. Will definitely return.

The service was very good. Some dishes were too salty. Overall food was ok. I'm just tired of restaurants that tell you at check-in that you only have 90 min to eat. It's so unnecessary and ruins the dining experience from the start. The food came out quickly so we were done in 60 min. I won't be back.
Authentic Thai flavors! The food at Chalong is bold, spicy, and truly reminds me of eating back home in Thailand .
Spicy and Amazing

The service is quick and the food is very good. The Baearng Gorlae were very flavorful and were like crispy tacos which was a nice surprise. The goat curry and the goat was so soft and tender. Finally the Tom Som Pla was a very nice warm soup that had a bright citrus taste that complemented the sea bass perfectly.
è¶…å¥½åƒï¼å¢¨é­šç‚’éºµè¶…å¥½åƒï¼
Great ambiance great food great service and the bartender was amazing too. He took great care of us! Anthony was amazing and made our night! Thanks!!!ğŸ™
This place is so nice and good service. Food was delicious I ordered Appetizers Baerng Golae. Platod and crab curry is  so fresh. Definitely gonna come back again.

Chalong Southern Thai delivers plates that show consistency and care. All aspects of Chalong Southern Thai show attention to detail - the food preparation, the space design, the atmosphere creation, and the service delivery. The personnel here excel beyond any service I've experienced. The kitchen lets the food quality speak volumes. I'm relieved I decided to try this place!

The place was packed even on a Monday night, which was surprising. Honestly, I think the online reviews were overrated. Most dishes were too salty and spicy, and the dessert was a total nightmare. Prices were a bit steep, and the waitress didnâ€™t look pleased with the tip. She didnâ€™t even say thank you when I paid.
Great and Frendly Service.   Great Hells Kitchen location.   Stor Goong is a must try.   Authentic Southern Thai.
the food was greatğŸ™‚excellent service!!!! Thank you ğŸ™

If you want an extremely flavorful meal this is your spot for good southern Thai. If you don't like spice or trying new things probably not the best spot for you. The food is excellent but also intense in flavor. Service is wonderful. Overall great place
So delicious, amazing service

Iâ€™m from Southern Thailand, and this is truly one of the best Thai cuisines in New York! The food was delicious and authentic - full of real Southern Thai flavor. The service was excellent, and J, our server, was very friendly and nice. Great atmosphere too. Highly recommend! Donâ€™t miss the Thai ice milk tea!!
went with a friend and loved the vibe and food was soo yummy. make a res!
Top Tier Thai in a beautiful but busy setting
Chalong is the epitome for what all restaurants try to strive for around the world!!! A++++++++

The food at Chalong Southern Thai was absolutely amazing! Me and my friend really enjoyed everything we tried. The Moo Hong was the highlight â€” so flavorful and tender â€” and the Pla Tod was perfectly crispy with delicious sauce. The flavors felt so authentic and reminded me of true Southern Thai cooking. Canâ€™t wait to go back and try more dishes from their menu!

The food was excellent! We had the crab curry which I would certainly recommend to anyone. We had a reservation (which we were able to get only a few days before!) and there were open tables. They had a 90 minute table policy, but the food arrived quickly and it worked out amazingly well as a pre-Broadway show meal location. We will definitely be back!
Must have if in the area

Had an exceptional experience with the staff who provided assistance with the menu. The drinks were amazing and the offerings were great compared to the typical Thai fare with amazing attention to the balance of flavors for each entree. Best Thai food on the East Coast in my opinion.
Amazing food and service. A bit loud, but most NYC restaurants are loud. Great value. Very authentic.
The lamb curry was delicious and the rot was just perfect, true Thai flavorsâ€¦ you wonâ€™t go wrong coming here,

Chalong Southern Thai is incredible! The flavors are bold, authentic, and full of that perfect southern Thai heat. Every dish tastes fresh and made with care â€” the curry and grilled meats were especially amazing. The staff are friendly and happy to help with recommendations, and the atmosphere is cozy but modern. Easily one of the best Thai restaurants Iâ€™ve been to â€” canâ€™t wait to come back!

Goat curry was fantastic
Soft shell crab dish was very good but a bit small
Service was excellent and time to get the food was really on point

Overall a great experience would go again
Food taste is good, but they are definitely pre-made.

This is a very popular restaurant for sure. The food was generally quite tasty. I really liked Pla Tod (fried fish) and See Eew Chicken. For Crab Curry, the curry sauce was very tasty, but it had just a small soft shell crab and it was difficult to find crab meat in the dish - I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth the price. Gorlae seemed to be a popular appetizer, but I didnâ€™t like it as the meat inside had an unpleasant taste for me.

We stopped by just before closing but it was an amazing cuisine in Hell Kitchen.  We are from Toronto so it takes alot of impress with ethnic food but These guys rocked it.

Flavour was exceptional, service truly professional and location was very good.

If I go back to NY ever again this would be one the reasons.

Ordered on uber eats because I had an absolutely delicious curry last time. The order was the chicken see-ew and potato dumplings, they are quick to make. I was in a rush but I was assured it would be delivered within 30 minutes. 30 minutes in the order was not even ready to be picked up so I canâ€™t even blame the third party app. I cancelled my order because, again, I was in a rush, but I was still forced to pay the restaurant for their time. Absolutely ridiculous and a waste of my time and money.

#girltime
#timesquare
#hellkitchen
#manhattan
#nyc

The best Thai food in Manhattan, NYC even better than many restaurants in Thailand .Canâ€™t believe I said this but itâ€™s true. Please check it out and you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Big applause to Chef NES . Her cooking style is meticulous and her food is so delicious because she made all her curry paste from the scratch and use fresh ingredients which made her food so outstanding. She is truly deserved Michelin star.  The staffs are polite and friendly. The restaurant decor is both modern and authentic to its name I know because I live in Phuket.
FantÃ¡stico thai. Con muy buena relaciÃ³n calidad/precio para Manhattan.
very busy restaurantï¼Œfood here is delicious

The crab curry was phenomenal. Very flavorful and plenty of crab meat. There was a soft shell crab in there that was great too. Also got the beef fried rice Khao Pad Mun Neur was really great too. Beef was flavorful and lots of fried garlic and shallots on the top. We got some complimentary chicken wings during lunch time which was also very great. Very unique Thai food and would go again
fantastic authentic southern Thai food served by a knowledgeable and friendly staff in a comfortable setting.  The food here is excellent.
We had several dishes to share, have mbo shirp, rice and some spice. They got the flavour just right. Rice reminded me of Thailand.
Great food and service!!
Always a good experience here. Here are my favorites.
Food was pretty good, and staff was quick. It's insanely loud in here though, as bad as a busy bar, so not a great place to eat & chat unless you when it's relatively empty.
Super great food, super beautiful deco and super super super attentive and nice waiters! Really enjoyed the food, and the place.

We were celebrating my 13th year living in NYC with a friend and my son did a little research and suggested we go here. He was not wrong! He had the Crab Curry, our friend the Kee Mao Seafood, while I had the Goong Karee. I ate all of my rice which I almost never do. And all of the dish of course. We sampled each other's dishes and all were just excellent (mine wasn't as spicy as theirs though, which was good for me). Didn't have room for desert as the portion sizes are more than enough to fill you up.

I am very grateful we ended up picking Chalong and we'll definitely have to come back again.
Definitely recommended - fair prices, very good, authentic food, great atmosphere and good service
Food is small portion. Hostess was not welcoming
Extraordinary

Excellent well fragrances well balanced food, indeed very close to what you get in high end locals in thailand. did nor disappoint / feom
duck curry ro squid ink rice

Elite dining experience. Fixed menu with a nice variety of options. I donâ€™t handle spice well (at all)â€¦. But I NEEDED the crab curry. It was heavenly and full of flavor. I couldnâ€™t stop eating it, in part to when I stopped eating it my mouth was bursting with warmth, but in the best way. Everyone in our group enjoyed their food but I think I got the best dish. Get the roti!! Itâ€™s a cozy little spot that you should definitely plan for and make a reservation!

We love this place! Itâ€™s perfect for sharing dishes with a group of friends. Highly recommend the crab curry and fried wings â€” both were packed with flavor. The fish was also delicious, though the portion was quite small. Overall, great spot for a fun, casual meal.

Iâ€™m Thai, and I can honestly say this place serves real Thai food. The flavors are authentic, balanced, and remind me of home. The atmosphere is fun and friendly, with a lively vibe that makes you feel welcome the moment you step in.

One thing to know: you really need to make a reservation before going. The restaurant is always packed, which tells you how popular it isâ€”but also means walk-ins are tough.

The staff were warm, attentive, and kept the energy upbeat even when the place was buzzing with people. Portions are generous, and the presentation is simple but full of characterâ€”just like true Thai food should be.

Definitely coming back!

Authentic, Flavorful Thai Food , Definitely Coming Back!

Stopped by Chalong Southern Thai for lunch and had a great experience. I got there right when they opened at 12, and it filled up fast always a good sign. The staff were super friendly and welcoming, and service was quick even as it got busy.

I ordered the See Lew Chicken and Kee Mao as part of their lunch special (Monday through Friday), and they even threw in two free wings with the meal. Everything was delicious and savory, well-seasoned, and super satisfying. You can tell they really care about the quality of their food.

It was about 100Â° outside, but inside was nice and cool thanks to the strong AC, which made lunch even more enjoyable.

For two people, with sparkling water, tax, and tip, we spent about $62. Felt totally worth it for the quality of food and service we got.

They did offer 5% off for writing a review, but I didnâ€™t take it this is just my honest take because they really earned the good feedback. Canâ€™t wait to come back and try more from the menu. Highly recommend if youâ€™re in the area and craving Thai food!

Everything we ordered was so flavorful and fresh, we couldnâ€™t stop eating! The Scallop and orange curry were spot on, and the Fish soup was hands down the best Iâ€™ve had in a long time. You can really tell they care about the quality of their ingredients.

The vibe of the place is super cozy and clean, and especially the staff, Bookie is just the sweetest, so kind, helpful, and welcoming. It felt like they really wanted us to have a good time (and we did!).

If youâ€™re craving some delicious, authentic Thai food with great service and a chill atmosphere, Cha Long Thai is definitely worth checking out. Weâ€™ll 100% be back soon!

It was a fantastic experience. I love Thai food, And didn't expect this restaurant offered so many options and special dishes that I never tried before. The seafood is so fresh and the taste is balanced perfectly. I will definitely come back in the future!!!

The crab curry was incredibly flavorful â€“ rich, creamy, and perfectly spiced. The shrimp tacos were absolutely outstanding: fresh, creative, and with a bold kick â€“ spicy but right on point! The service was warm and attentive throughout. Chalong has definitely earned a spot on my list of favorite places. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

The crab curry is the best, it is spicy but tasty. The  rest of the dishes are just so so, definitely doesnâ€™t match the 4.8 review! The restaurant will take 5% off the bill for positive google reviews. Soâ€¦.
By the way, the mango stick rice is not that great and the whole fry fish the restaurant service lady will push you to order really wasnâ€™t that tasty at all.
Good luck!

Came with a group and were seated immediately. Got goat curry, crab curry, and a few desserts, all were perfectly balanced sweet, sour, and spicy. Friends got steamed fish that was also absolutely incredible.
Will definitely be coming back here in the future to try more items and cocktails.

Had a good time here! The food is definitely very well-made, and something to note is that they donâ€™t do substitutions. I definitely have not seen a lot of Thai places serve these kinds of dishes, so this is definitely a unique dining experience that is worth trying.

I do personally think that this place might be better suited for parties of 3-4 people. We came as a party of 2, and I just felt like we didnâ€™t get to try a lot of variety. Our two entrees of goat curry and pla tod (the fried fish) had us decently full, but we didnâ€™t get to try any apps and the bill was already $80 (after tax, before tip). And, to be very honest, halfway through the two dishes the flavours began to feel slightly monotonous. We started wanting a bit of lime/acid to brighten the sweetness of the sauce for the fish. The freshness of some appetizers/sides would have been great to break up the flavours, but it would then have been too much food (not to mention more expensive). I feel like if we had 3-4 people, we could have gotten 2-3 apps and some smaller appetizers or sides to pair with our meal, and that would have made it feel more well rounded.

I do want to stress, however, that the food was very well made and came without much wait. While I wish that there was a touch more space between some of the tables, I have to say that the interior of the restaurant is beautifully decorated and has a great vibe. Make a reservation! This is a busy place and there can easily be a wait.

Stumbled upon Chalong on the Michelin Guide and decided to give it a try, and it absolutely delivered. Walked in on a Sunday afternoon and waited about 15 minutes for a table, not bad at all. The staff were friendly and the service was quick. Our server recommended their must-try dishes, so we went with the Baerng Golae and Crab Curry, both were absolutely excellent. Packed with bold, punchy, yet balanced flavors that instantly make you crave more. Truly authentic Thai taste. Portion sizes are decent, and the quality justifies the price. Will definitely be back to explore more of the menu. 100% recommend if youâ€™re in the mood for great Thai food.

The flavors of all of the dishes here were incredible! Definitely try the Green Curry Brisket and the Crab Curry, two of the best main courses. The Gorlae shrimp appetizer was also delicious, we could've eaten those over and over.

Chalong brings the authenticity of southern Thai cuisine to the Big Apple. Legitimately the best seafood and southern Thai cuisine west of Bangkok. They do not hold back on the spice or fish sauce hereâ€” and thatâ€™s exactly what makes Chalong great. If youâ€™re Thai and homesick for hometown flavors, Chalong is the place for you. Great ambience, great service (special shoutout to Alice!), and great food. Cannot recommend enough.
Recommended by one of my colleagues and it sure did not disappoint. Love the way the chefs utilize different types of spices and herbs to compliment every single dish here. Bravo!

I had a fantastic meal at Cha Long! From the moment we walked in, the cozy modern decor and lively atmosphere set the tone for a great dining experience. Por our server was super friendly and attentive, which made everything feel even more welcoming.

The food absolutely delicious. The deep-fried whole fish was beautifully presented and had a crispy exterior with tender meat inside. The stir-fried dish with shrimp and bitter beans packed a punch with bold Southern Thai flavors, while the fried rice was fragrant and full of texture. We also got the crispy pork belly, which had a satisfying crunch and a rich flavor that paired so well with the spicy dipping sauce.

The drinks were just as fun and flavorful as the food! Each one was beautifully presented, and I especially loved the one garnished with a spicy dried shrimp skewerâ€”such a creative touch.

Definitely recommend this place if youâ€™re in the mood for thoughtfully prepared Thai food with a chill but refined vibe. Iâ€™ll be coming back to try more!

I love the food and the atmosphere here. Sea takes good care of me, like super friendly, especially when I am sweating a lot and my stomach feels burning after having goat curry which is too spicy for me. But the goat is so amazingly cooked in southern Thailand way. And the appetizer girls tastes super yummy. Just trust the recommendations their waiters/ waitresses give

I find Chalong to be an absolute gem in Hell's Kitchen. It's a small, intimate spot, so the focus is truly on the food. I love the intensity and authenticity of their Southern Thai flavorsâ€”it's a welcome departure from the usual sweetness of other spots. The Kua Kling is a personal favorite; its fiery, dry-fried heat is truly addictive. Itâ€™s the kind of place I take friends who appreciate genuine, uncompromisingly spicy and flavorful Thai food.

Everything was spot on, from the food, to the drinks, to the service. We especially loved the fish (we had fried and steamed). The waitress, Fern, was cheerful and accommodating. The cocktails were picturesque and a great pairing with the meal. We recommend Chalong to anyone looking for an authentic Southern Thai experience.

Absolutely amazing experience!
The service was excellentâ€”friendly, attentive, and welcoming from start to finish. The food is truly authentic Southern Thai cuisine. Pla Tod was hands down the best Iâ€™ve hadâ€”crispy, perfectly seasoned, and bursting with flavor also made a good combination with crab curry. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for real Thai food and great hospitality!

One of the best thai restaurants in New York. The staff are so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Theyâ€™re more than happy to help you figure out what to eat. The rice dumplings can be skipped but the Pla Tod and Crab Curry are worth the hype. The flavors pack a punch without being overwhelming. Overall, a lovely dinner at Chalong

Amazing food and great service! We tried the Lumpu salad with scallop inside - very fresh. Tom Som Pia with sea bass was also very tasty with sour and spicy flavor. Crab curry had both crab meat and soft she'll crab inside with lots of curry broth. All dishes We has were very tasty and would definitely go again!

Worst Thai food Iâ€™ve had in NYC. Portions were tiny â€” two people, three dishes and a dessert, all finished because it was too pricey to waste.
$29 crab curry had half a soft-shell crab. Server said, â€œThatâ€™s how it always is.â€
$33 steamed fish was just a small piece, not even palm-sized, and salty.
Goat curry was dry and way too salty.
Paid $142 with tip. Iâ€™ve tried tons of Thai spots in NYC â€” flavors here are average at best, and the portions make it a terrible deal. Definitely not worth it, especially for group meals.

One of my fave Thai spots now - food was incredibly tasty and they deserve all the hype. The servers were great and the hostess was accommodating of my late friends. Will be back and highly recommend!

Everything about this restaurant is â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’›

The whole staff was very friendly and sweet , the food was clean and so delicious.

The drink i tried was really really tasty.

I forgot to take photos of some of the food because we all ate it so fast.

The  chicken  with the wide noodles, the crispy pork, everything deeelicious high quality stuff.

It was bustling and they deserve it!!!ğŸ©·ğŸ©·ğŸ©·ğŸ©·ğŸ©·ğŸ©·

12/10 recommend.

Absolutely incredible dining experience! The flavors were authentic and bursting with freshnessâ€”every dish we tried was delicious, especially the Curry. The service was warm and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. Highly recommend this gem for anyone craving amazing Thai food. Will definitely be back!

Got the lunch special that came with a side of free wings. The wings were very crispy, the best Iâ€™ve ever had. The shrimp fried rice was also very tasty and such a good portion for the $19 lunch deal. Would highly recommend ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

Loved the meal at Chalong. The atmosphere was vibrant, the food authentic, and it was refreshing to enjoy true Southern Thai flavors. The service staff were polite and attentive. Iâ€™ll definitely be back â€” highly recommend to anyone looking for a great Thai dining experience.

Amazing food! We had the dumplings, taco looking things and crab curry were mouthwatering and absolutely delicious! I had a drink called her hand honey which was so different and yummy! Highly recommended!

Heard good things about this place, so decided to make a reservation while in NYC. We were seated about 15 mins after our reservation and greeted promptly. Ordered cocktails which were tasty and unique. The cocktail with the shrimp paste is a must try. We shared the dumplings, which were good but couldâ€™ve been better. For entrees we had the southern style pad Thai and the crab curry. Pad Thai was tasty but not overly exciting. Crab curry was delicious and would 100% order again. Perfect spice and lots of lump crab.

Iâ€™ve heard a lot of people talking about Chalong, and I finally had a chance to try it before leaving New York. As a Thai person, I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting New Yorkâ€”donâ€™t miss the chance to try the Thai food here! You wonâ€™t be disappointed. The presentation and service were excellent. Wan was my serverâ€”she was very nice and kind.

Food and service was great! The lychee thai tea was a refreshing take on the classic thai iced tea. The shrimp tacos with coconut crisp were a great way to start the meal. The fried fish was crispy and light. The goat curry was rich and savory and paired perfectly with the roti. The shrimp fried rice perfectly was spicy and salty and was accompanied by a ton of fried garlic and shallots which made it taste way better. Definitely recommend!

A very special Thai restaurant in both food and decoration, rated by Michelin, wild Chilean cod with a rich Thai sour sauce and herbs, the fish meat is fragrant, sweet and fatty, mixed with the characteristic sourness of Thai flavor, very explosive to the taste buds. Crab curry with a very fragrant and fatty sauce, stir-fried vegetables are crispy, sweet, rich in garlic, just right to eat. Delicious white rice with the characteristic aroma of Thai rice. A great address worthy of keeping beautiful memories in New York.

Amazing Thai food, comparable to Elmhurst. We ordered a matcha rum cocktail (Leonardo on the beach), lumpu salad, steamed fish and pumpkin purple sticky rice dessert. Everything was tasty although on the pricier side of the scale. Love the complex flavors, layered texture, tasteful presentation and welcoming service.
